metadata.longDescription: Azure Service Bus is a generic, cloud-based messaging system for connecting just about anything—applications, services, and devices—wherever they are. Connect apps running on Azure, on-premises systems, or both. You can even use Service Bus to connect household appliances, sensors, and other devices like tablets or phones to a central application or to each other.

plans.name: basic
plans.description: Support queues and scheduled messages. Message Size: 256 KB. Brokered connections included: 100. See details: https://azure.microsoft.com/en-us/pricing/details/service-bus/

bullets: Pay only for what you use

plans.name: standard
plans.description: Support queues, scheduled messages, topics, transactions, and so on. Message Size: 256 KB. Brokered connections included: 1000.

bullets: Pay only for what you use

plans.name: premium
plans.description: Support queues, scheduled messages, topics, transactions, and so on. Message Size: 1 MB. Brokered connections included: 1000 per MU.

bullets: Pay only for what you use
